channel.title: Latest PHMSA Hazardous Materials Incident Reports, for MO
channel.description: The latest Form 5800.1 hazardous material reports submitted to the Department of Transportation and posted online by the Pipeline and Hazardous Materials Safety Administration, for MO

item.title: Report X-2024041065
item.description:
Report X-2024041065

Identified by scraper @ 2024-04-24T15:12:15+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-04-09
  • City: EARTH CITY
  • State: MO
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: UNITED PARCEL SERVICE
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: RESPONDER WAS CALLED TO THE SD1 FOR A LEAKING FLMAMMABLE LIQUID HAZMAT. RESPONDER SHOWED UP WITH PPE ON AND SPILL CART. UTILIZING THE DECISION TREE, RESPONDER CLEANED UP THE SPILL. LEAKING PACKAGE AND CONTAMINATED DEBRIS WERE PLACED INTO A SPILL TUB AND TRANSPORTED BACK TO DMP CAGE FOR FURTHER PROCESSING.

item.title: Report X-2024040801
item.description:
Report X-2024040801

Identified by scraper @ 2024-04-22T15:11:57+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-04-13
  • City: KANSAS CITY
  • State: MO
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: SequenceEvent: During inspection it was noted that the four gallons were put inside a plastic bag and tied with a zip tie. The gallons were not actively leaking but there was a strong smell and the inside of the bag was damp. Two of the gallons looked like they had lost fluid. DescribePack: The box was wet. The inside of the bag was wet. I am unsure where the leak came from DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: The package was placed inside a plastic lined tote and put in the hazmat cage.

item.title: Report X-2024040831
item.description:
Report X-2024040831

Identified by scraper @ 2024-04-22T15:11:57+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-04-10
  • City: KANSAS CITY
  • State: MO
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: SequenceEvent: THE HAZMAT WAS FOUND WITH THE BOTTOM SOAKED. THE ADMIN CAREFULLY PLACED THE PACKAGE INTO A LINED TOTE AND BROUGHT IT TO THE HAZ CAGE FOR INSPECTION. DescribePack: THE ITEM WAS FOUND ON ITS SIDE IN A PLASTIC BAG FILLING WITH THE LIQUID FROM THE JUG. THE BOX HAD BUBBLE WRAP IN IT BUT DID NOT HELP SUPPORT THE ITEM FROM STAYING UPRIGHT. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: EVERYTHING WAS PLACED INSIDE A LINED DRUM FOR PROCESSING.

item.title: Report X-2024040616
item.description:
Report X-2024040616

  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident

  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: SequenceEvent: package found leaking on dock PH test performed to verify that it was the Hazmat that was leaking. ph levels showed that the hazmat was leaking. package was placed in hazmat tote and brought to hazmat area DescribePack: marks approximately half way down box shows some wear possibly from another package or packing starps DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: package was placed in hazmat tote and brought to hazmat area

Upon inspection it was noted that the cans were very dented and fluid was coming out of them DescribePack: cans were dented DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: the package was placed inside a plastic lined tote and put in the hamzat cage for inspection

item.title: Report X-2024040520
item.description:
Report X-2024040520

  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident

  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: SequenceEvent: Plastic drum leaking outside of tralier on dock, manager with ppe and neutralizer cleaned spill placed the leaking pail in hazmat tote and taken immidately to hazmat cage. DescribePack: seals broken on pour spout on lid DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: lined hazmat tote placed on ventilated table neturalizer used
